content.description: Start on the jug and move to the crimps on the right then heel hook the start and go straight up to a crimp jug to top out
content.protection: One pad should do the job for the top out and/or protecting your ankles when you drop down
content.location: There's an obvious jug on the side of the boulder that faces the cabins and is right in front of the bushes.

content.description:
Many variations are possible, but I started on the north side in the far corner on some good edges. The crux comes immediately by traversing left on some thin crimps and mediocre feet. Move off the crimps to a good edge, and then reach wide left for a hidden jug. Top out by throwing a heel on the ledge hold and standing up.

It is possible that the traverse could be made longer in either direction, as there are definitely good holds. The boulder would need some more cleaning and some of the brush might need to be cut back a small amount.
content.protection: Very low and clear landing, no pads needed.
content.location: Starts on good edges on the northwest corner of the boulder.
